adjective.description: Relating to ancient Rome or its empire or people.

examples: the Roman Church's instructions to its clergy

adjective.description: Denoting the alphabet (or any of the letters in it) used for writing Latin, English, and most European languages, developed in ancient Rome.
(of type) of a plain upright kind used in ordinary print, especially as distinguished from italic.

noun.description: A citizen or soldier of the ancient Roman Republic or Empire.

origin: Middle English: from Old French Romain, from Latin Romanus, from Roma Rome.
